**Disclaimer:** This sell-side report was generated using Grok 4.1 Fast Reasoning (grok-4-1-fast-reasoning). Please confirm all critical data independently, as AI models may hallucinate. These reports are for educational purposes only, and should not be solely used for investment decisions. Grok's API is currently limited to information up to the **end of 2024**. Claude's Sonnet 4.5 has access to up-to-date information, but is considerably more expensive per output (nearly $1 per ticker). In the always-evolving world of investing, we understand it is **CRITICAL** to have up-to-date information to help make the best investment decisions, and it is our goal to provide this information. But considering there are thousands of companies that we would ideally be updating monthly, as well as future goals of also providing quick and digestible summaries and insights for newly released earnings and conference calls, breaking news, FED speeches, etc, this quickly becomes very costly. For this reason, please consider **subscribing to our Patreon** or donating to enable QuickTick AI to provide as much value and up-to-date insight as possible to **allow you to make the most informed investment decisions with a level of efficiency not possible even a few years ago.** 100% of the funds will go straight to purchasing more API credits to continue expanding our high quality, up-to-date analysis for more and more companies, and further then into our future value-generating plans. Thanks! - QuickTick AI --- # EOG Resources Inc. (EOG) Sell-Side Analysis Report **Date of Report:** October 11, 2024 **Current Stock Price:** $128.32 (Yahoo Finance, as of market close Oct 11, 2024) **Market Capitalization:** $75.07 billion (Yahoo Finance, as of Oct 11, 2024) **52-Week Range:** $111.22 - $147.23 ## Company Overview (High-Level Summary) EOG Resources, Inc. (NYSE: EOG) is one of the largest independent exploration and production (E&P) companies in the United States, focused exclusively on onshore crude oil and natural gas development in premium shale plays. Headquartered in Houston, Texas, EOG operates primarily in the Permian Basin (Delaware and Northwest Shelves, ~60% of production), Eagle Ford Shale (~20%), Bakken (~10%), and smaller positions in the Barnett Shale and Rockies. The company emphasizes technological innovation, including advanced completion designs, data analytics, and cube developments (simultaneous multi-well pads), to maximize returns on capital employed (ROCE) rather than aggressive volume growth. As of Q2 2024, EOG reported proved reserves of 4.3 billion barrels of oil equivalent (BOE), with ~70% liquids-rich. It differentiates through a low-cost structure (average lease operating expense ~$5-7/BOE), strong balance sheet (net debt ~$1B, investment-grade rating BBB/Baa2), and shareholder returns via variable dividends and buybacks. EOG avoids international exposure post-2014 divestitures, focusing on U.S. basins with short-cycle inventory for multi-decade drilling opportunities. In 2023, it produced ~992,000 BOE/d, targeting flat-to-slight growth in 2024 at ~1 million BOE/d amid oil price volatility. (Word count: 218) ## Recent Developments - **Q2 2024 Earnings (Aug 1, 2024):** Beat expectations with revenue of $6.04B (vs. $5.77B est.), adjusted EPS $2.97 (vs. $2.68 est.). Net income $1.75B. Production averaged 1.03 million BOE/d (up 5% YoY), with crude oil at 633,000 Bbl/d. Cash from operations $3.6B; returned $2.2B to shareholders (dividend + buybacks). Announced 7% dividend hike to $0.83/Q (Oct 17 ex-date). - **Q3 2024 Guidance (Aug 1, 2024):** Oil production 660-680 MBbl/d; capex $2.1-2.3B for H2; expects Permian cube developments to drive efficiency. - **Permian Well Results (Sep 2024 Investor Day):** Record 30-day IP rates in Delaware Basin: Dorado Gold/3-mile laterals at 2,200 BOE/d (82% oil); Northeast shelf at 1,800+ BOE/d. - **Share Repurchases:** $1.5B YTD through Q2; $3B authorization remaining as of Aug 2024. - **Hurricane Impacts (Sep 2024):** Minimal Eagle Ford downtime from Beryl/Francine; production normalized by late Sep. ## Growth Strategy - **Capital Discipline:** 2024 capex $5.5-5.7B focused on high-return inventory (>60% IRR at $60/WTI); prioritize Permian (70% capex) for cube tech scaling to 40+ wells/pad. - **Tech-Driven Efficiency:** AI/ML for frac optimization; extended laterals (2-3 miles); non-refrac pilots in Eagle Ford/Bakken showing 2x EUR uplift. - **Inventory Extension:** 10+ years Tier 1 locations; targeting 5-10% annual efficiency gains to offset depletion. - **Shareholder Returns:** 60%+ of free cash flow (FCF) returned; dynamic dividend policy tied to oil prices; goal of $7-10B cumulative FCF in 2024-2025 at $70-80 WTI. ## Company and Sector Headwinds and Tailwinds | Category | Headwinds | Tailwinds | |----------|-----------|-----------| | **Company-Specific** | - Eagle Ford gas glut pressure (20% of output); Q3 oil realization down to $77/Bbl est. due to LLS discounts.
- Inventory maturation risk in Bakken (~10% prod.). | - Permian dominance: Lowest breakevens (~$35-40/BOE); record well productivity +15% YoY.
- Balance sheet: $5.7B cash (Q2); net debt/EBITDA <0.2x. | | **Sector-Wide (Oil & Gas E&P)** | - Oil price volatility (WTI ~$70/Bbl Oct 2024); OPEC+ cuts expiring Dec 2024.
- Regulatory: Potential methane rules, Permian flaring limits (post-2024 election risks).
- Service cost inflation +5-10% YoY. | - Global demand growth: +1.2 MMbbl/d in 2024 (IEA); U.S. LNG exports +15% YoY.
- Supply constraints: Non-OPEC decline -1.4 MMbbl/d; U.S. shale moderation (rig count -10% YoY). | ## Existing Products/Services - **Core Operations:** Crude oil (64% of Q2 production), NGLs (17%), natural gas (19%). Key assets: Permian (Delaware/NW Shelf), Eagle Ford (oil/gas/NGL), Bakken (light oil). - **Marketing:** Direct sales to refiners/pipelines; hedges minimal (<10% oil prod. for 2025). ## New Products/Services/Projects - **Permian Dorado Program:** Multi-bench cube devts. (2024-2025); 40-well pads in progress, targeting 20%+ productivity gains. - **Eagle Ford Refracs:** Pilots (Q2 2024) with 2-3x oil recovery; scaling to 10-20 ops in 2025. - **Bakken Non-Refracs:** Chemical/frac tech pilots; first results Q3 2024 showing +50% EUR. - **CCUS Exploration:** Early-stage carbon capture pilots in Permian (announced 2023; updates Q4 2024 expected). ## Market Share Approximations and Forecast - **U.S. Shale Oil Production:** ~5-6% share (Permian ~8-10%; ~400-450 MBbl/d of ~7 MMbbl/d total U.S. shale oil, per EIA Sep 2024). - **Permian Basin:** ~7% operator share (2nd to Pioneer post-2024 Exxon deal; EIA Aug 2024 data). - **Forecast:** Stable-to-slight gain to 6-7% U.S. shale by 2026 via Permian efficiency; offset by consolidation (e.g., peers acquired). Decline risk if WTI < $60 sustained. ## Comparison to Competitors | Metric (Q2 2024 or TTM) | EOG | Devon Energy (DVN) | Occidental (OXY) | Hess (HES)* | Pioneer (PXD, pre-XOM) | |--------------------------|-----|---------------------|-------------------|--------------|-------------------------| | **Prod. (MBOE/d)** | 1,030 | 659 | 1,193 | 419 | 785 | | **Oil %** | 62% | 56% | 52% | 75% | 57% | | **Breakeven ($/BOE)** | $35-40 | $40-45 | $45-50 | $40-45 | $35-40 | | **ROCE (2024 est.)** | 15-20% | 12-15% | 10-12% | 18% | 18% | | **Debt/EBITDA** | 0.2x | 0.6x | 1.5x | 0.5x | 0.3x | *HES transitioning post-Chevron deal. **Key Edges:** EOG leads in ROCE/cost metrics; pure-play shale vs. OXY's chemicals/CCUS. ## Partnerships, M&A, Current/Potential Major Clients - **Partnerships:** Minimal; JVs with Occidental in Permian (legacy); tech collab with SLB for AI frac design (2023). - **M&A:** Acquirer stance; $2.5B South Texas Eagle Ford bolt-ons (2023); no major 2024 deals. Watching post-Exxon/Pioneer consolidation for tuck-ins. - **Clients:** Refiners (Valero, Phillips 66 ~20-30% Eagle Ford/Permian oil); pipelines (EPIC Express for Permian). Potential: LNG exporters (Cheniere, Sempra) for gas; growing NGL offtake to exports. ## Other Qualitative Measures - **ESG:** Top-quartile methane intensity (0.15%); 95%+ flaring reduction; Scope 1/2 targets met early. - **Management:** CEO Billy Helms (2023); track record of 15%+ IRR discipline. - **Risks:** Commodity exposure (80% unhedged); basin-specific (Permian spacing wars). - **Opportunities:** AI drilling (20% cycle time cut); LNG boom for gas byproducts. ## Investment Recommendation - **Buy Rating:** 8/10 (Strong Buy/Hold for Growth) â€“ EOG's premium inventory, efficiency, and FCF yield (~8-10% at $70 WTI) offer upside in a $75-85 oil environment. Moderate risk via balance sheet; growth via tech > volume. - **Fair Value Estimate:** $155/share (20% upside). Based on 10x 2025E FCF ($11-12/share at $75 WTI; EV/BOE $12/20yr reserves); peers at 9-11x. Catalysts: Q3 beat (Nov 7), dividend growth. Risks: Oil < $65 caps at $130.
